crypto.name: ECC
crypto.desc:
Author: Monk

Can you get the secret key from the following two signed messages?

1st Message: "The secp256r1 curve was used."

2nd Message: "k value may have been re-used."

1st Signature r value: 91684750294663587590699225454580710947373104789074350179443937301009206290695

1st Signature s value: 8734396013686485452502025686012376394264288962663555711176194873788392352477

2nd Signature r value: 91684750294663587590699225454580710947373104789074350179443937301009206290695

2nd Signature s value: 96254287552668750588265978919231985627964457792323178870952715849103024292631

The flag is the secret key used to sign the messages. It will be in the flag format.

crypto.name: Mod
crypto.desc:
Author: GoldenBushRobin

Simply mod. Surely it's simple

crypto.name: RC4 Prefix
crypto.desc:
Author: GoldenBushRobin

RC4 has a bad key scheduling algorithm, but do you know how bad? Given a choice of a prefix, can you leak the rest of the key using only one byte of encrypted output?

crypto.name: Smelter
crypto.desc:
Author: flocto

I've added 2048 bits of security, so there's no way you can forge anything in this smelter.

forensic.name: Code
forensic.desc:
Author: Monk

What does this image mean??

forensic.name: Conspiracy Theory
forensic.desc:
Author: moveslow

You've gotta believe me bro there's something here man. It's not a conspiracy. It's real im telling you!

forensic.name: Deflated
forensic.desc:
Author: flocto

I heard ZipCrypto Store has a vulnerability, so I've used ZipCrypto Deflate instead. Can you still get the flag?

Notes

    Flag matches regex gigem{[A-Z0-9_]+}.
    Do not try to brute force the password. It is not in any password list.

forensic.name: NII
forensic.desc:
Author: Monk

Can't seem to open the file.

forensic.name: RSA Crack
forensic.desc:
Author: Monk

Can you decrypt the flag?

misc.name: Forward to the Past
misc.desc:
Author: k.nix

My school requires student event travel to be filed in advance, but I completely forgot! Worse, Southwest CCDC has already passed! Can you insert a travel record for March 21, 2025?

misc.name: Sandbox
misc.desc:
Author: cobra

I made a program where you can practice running commands in a sandboxed environment.

misc.name: Sandbox 2
misc.desc:
Author: cobra

I think I fixed it... just removed that silly ampersand.

misc.name: pycjailplusplus
misc.desc:
Author: flocto

Inspired by pycjail-returns from AngstromCTF 2024. Now with less builtins!

Remote is really slow, please wait up to 2 minutes for the prompt to appear after finishing the PoW

pwn.name: Debug 1
pwn.desc:
Author: FlamePyromancer

I made a program which inverts the capitalization of letters! Surely there's nothing insecure with the program, right?

pwn.name: Debug 2
pwn.desc:
Author: FlamePyromancer

My friends gave me some advice to fix my code because apparently there were "glaring security flaws". Not sure what they meant, but now my code is more secure than ever!

pwn.name: ROP Thirteen
pwn.desc:
Author: FlamePyromancer

I wanted to make a ROT13 encoder, so here it is! I also made sure to make it as efficient as possible.

Note: The binary is compiled using Go 1.20.6.

pwn.name: Sniper
pwn.desc:
Author: nhwn

I feel like there's an unlimited supply of format string challenges with this name.

pwn.name: Stack
pwn.desc:
Author: nhwn

It's nice to review our fundamental data structures every now and then.

rev.name: Brainrot
rev.desc:
Author: flocto

This challenge is only solvable in Ohio 😂😂.

Note: This challenge requires -k to run properly.

rev.name: FastFlagChecker
rev.desc:
Author: flocto

My flagchecker is so fast, I give every bit its own thread!

Flag format is gigem{[A-Za-z0-9_]+}.

rev.name: OTP
rev.desc:
Author: nhwn

I heard one-time pads are unbreakable, so it should be impossible to recover the flag, right?

rev.name: Simple Check
rev.desc:
Author: Addison

I've given you a binary that allows you to read any file on the system. So, go ahead and read the flag. If you need to debug anything, I've put a helpful call logger on the remote.

rev.name: What It Does
rev.desc:
Author: flocto

What does it do? Does it do what it does?

rev.name: Xorox
rev.desc:
Author: flocto

Today I will xor my flag with a key.

Note: Only the correct flag will make the binary print Yup

web.name: Aggie Bookstore
web.desc:
Author: moveslow

Unfortunately it seems I've forgotten the name of my book...

Note: the flag format will be FLAG{...} instead of gigem{...}.

web.name: Modern Banking
web.desc:
Author: Carcharodon

Our local bank has been hearing about this fancy new thing called the internet for a while. While they still think it's a bit too new to spend too much effort on, they've decided to make an online banking site. And what better language than the language the rest of the bank's services are written in?

web.name: Moving Slowly
web.desc:
Author: moveslow

Everyone's been talking about how AI is the future and will be in everything so I added AI to my login panel!

Note: The password is alphanumeric.

web.name: Research
web.desc:
Author: cobra

My professor made a website to compile LaTeX for his research. Everything is securely stored with encryption, but I wonder if there's still a way to get access to what he's working on...

Note: The challenge is reset every 5 minutes to ensure stability.
